name: ByteData
comment:
A fixed-length, random-access sequence of bytes that also provides random and unaligned access to the fixed-width integers and floating point numbers represented by those bytes. ByteData may be used to pack and unpack data from external sources (such as networks or files systems), and to process large quantities of numerical data more efficiently than would be possible with ordinary dart-core.List implementations. ByteData can save space, by eliminating the need for object headers, and time, by eliminating the need for data copies. Finally, ByteData may be used to intentionally reinterpret the bytes representing one arithmetic type as another. For example this code fragment determine what 32-bit signed integer is represented by the bytes of a 32-bit floating point number:

var buffer = new Uint8List(8).buffer;
var bdata = new ByteData.view(buffer);
bdata.setFloat32(0, 3.04);
int huh = bdata.getInt32(0);

elementSizeInBytes.name: elementSizeInBytes
elementSizeInBytes.comment: Returns the number of bytes in the representation of each element in this list.

constructors.comment: Creates a dart-typed_data.ByteData of the specified length (in elements), all of whose elements are initially zero.

view.name: view
view.comment:
Creates an dart-typed_data.ByteData view of the specified region in the specified byte buffer. Changes in the dart-typed_data.ByteData will be visible in the byte buffer and vice versa. If the dart-typed_data.ByteData.ByteData-view.offsetInBytes index of the region is not specified, it defaults to zero (the first byte in the byte buffer). If the length is not specified, it defaults to null, which indicates that the view extends to the end of the byte buffer.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.ByteData-view.offsetInBytes or dart-typed_data.ByteData.ByteData-view.length are negative, or if dart-typed_data.ByteData.ByteData-view.offsetInBytes + (dart-typed_data.ByteData.ByteData-view.length * elementSizeInBytes) is greater than the length of dart-typed_data.ByteData.ByteData-view.buffer.

getFloat32.name: getFloat32
getFloat32.comment:
Returns the floating point number represented by the four bytes at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.getFloat32.byteOffset in this object, in IEEE 754 single-precision binary floating-point format (binary32).

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.getFloat32.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 4 is greater than the length of this object.

getFloat64.name: getFloat64
getFloat64.comment:
Returns the floating point number represented by the eight bytes at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.getFloat64.byteOffset in this object, in IEEE 754 double-precision binary floating-point format (binary64).

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.getFloat64.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 8 is greater than the length of this object.

getInt16.name: getInt16
getInt16.comment:
Returns the (possibly negative) integer represented by the two bytes at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.getInt16.byteOffset in this object, in two's complement binary form. The return value will be between 2<sup>15</sup> and 2<sup>15</sup> - 1, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.getInt16.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 2 is greater than the length of this object.

getInt32.name: getInt32
getInt32.comment:
Returns the (possibly negative) integer represented by the four bytes at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.getInt32.byteOffset in this object, in two's complement binary form. The return value will be between 2<sup>31</sup> and 2<sup>31</sup> - 1, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.getInt32.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 4 is greater than the length of this object.

getInt64.name: getInt64
getInt64.comment:
Returns the (possibly negative) integer represented by the eight bytes at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.getInt64.byteOffset in this object, in two's complement binary form. The return value will be between 2<sup>63</sup> and 2<sup>63</sup> - 1, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.getInt64.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 8 is greater than the length of this object.

getInt8.name: getInt8
getInt8.comment:
Returns the (possibly negative) integer represented by the byte at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.getInt8.byteOffset in this object, in two's complement binary representation. The return value will be between -128 and 127, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.getInt8.byteOffset is negative, or greater than or equal to the length of this object.

getUint16.name: getUint16
getUint16.comment:
Returns the positive integer represented by the two bytes starting at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.getUint16.byteOffset in this object, in unsigned binary form. The return value will be between 0 and 2<sup>16</sup> - 1, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.getUint16.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 2 is greater than the length of this object.

getUint32.name: getUint32
getUint32.comment:
Returns the positive integer represented by the four bytes starting at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.getUint32.byteOffset in this object, in unsigned binary form. The return value will be between 0 and 2<sup>32</sup> - 1, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.getUint32.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 4 is greater than the length of this object.

getUint64.name: getUint64
getUint64.comment:
Returns the positive integer represented by the eight bytes starting at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.getUint64.byteOffset in this object, in unsigned binary form. The return value will be between 0 and 2<sup>64</sup> - 1, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.getUint64.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 8 is greater than the length of this object.

getUint8.name: getUint8
getUint8.comment:
Returns the positive integer represented by the byte at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.getUint8.byteOffset in this object, in unsigned binary form. The return value will be between 0 and 255, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.getUint8.byteOffset is negative, or greater than or equal to the length of this object.

setFloat32.name: setFloat32
setFloat32.comment:
Sets the four bytes starting at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setFloat32.byteOffset in this object to the IEEE 754 single-precision binary floating-point (binary32) representation of the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setFloat32.value.

Note that this method can lose precision. The input dart-typed_data.ByteData.setFloat32.value is a 64-bit floating point value, which will be converted to 32-bit floating point value by IEEE 754 rounding rules before it is stored. If dart-typed_data.ByteData.setFloat32.value cannot be represented exactly as a binary32, it will be converted to the nearest binary32 value. If two binary32 values are equally close, the one whose least significant bit is zero will be used. Note that finite (but large) values can be converted to infinity, and small non-zero values can be converted to zero.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.setFloat32.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 4 is greater than the length of this object.

setFloat64.name: setFloat64
setFloat64.comment:
Sets the eight bytes starting at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setFloat64.byteOffset in this object to the IEEE 754 double-precision binary floating-point (binary64) representation of the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setFloat64.value.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.setFloat64.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 8 is greater than the length of this object.

setInt16.name: setInt16
setInt16.comment:
Sets the two bytes starting at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt16.byteOffset in this object to the two's complement binary representation of the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt16.value, which must fit in two bytes. In other words, dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt16.value must lie between 2<sup>15</sup> and 2<sup>15</sup> - 1, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt16.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 2 is greater than the length of this object.

setInt32.name: setInt32
setInt32.comment:
Sets the four bytes starting at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt32.byteOffset in this object to the two's complement binary representation of the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt32.value, which must fit in four bytes. In other words, dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt32.value must lie between 2<sup>31</sup> and 2<sup>31</sup> - 1, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt32.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 4 is greater than the length of this object.

setInt64.name: setInt64
setInt64.comment:
Sets the eight bytes starting at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt64.byteOffset in this object to the two's complement binary representation of the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt64.value, which must fit in eight bytes. In other words, dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt64.value must lie between 2<sup>63</sup> and 2<sup>63</sup> - 1, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt64.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 8 is greater than the length of this object.

setInt8.name: setInt8
setInt8.comment:
Sets the byte at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt8.byteOffset in this object to the two's complement binary representation of the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt8.value, which must fit in a single byte. In other words, dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt8.value must be between -128 and 127, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.setInt8.byteOffset is negative, or greater than or equal to the length of this object.

setUint16.name: setUint16
setUint16.comment:
Sets the two bytes starting at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint16.byteOffset in this object to the unsigned binary representation of the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint16.value, which must fit in two bytes. in other words, dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint16.value must be between 0 and 2<sup>16</sup> - 1, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint16.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 2 is greater than the length of this object.

setUint32.name: setUint32
setUint32.comment:
Sets the four bytes starting at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint32.byteOffset in this object to the unsigned binary representation of the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint32.value, which must fit in four bytes. in other words, dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint32.value must be between 0 and 2<sup>32</sup> - 1, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint32.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 4 is greater than the length of this object.

setUint64.name: setUint64
setUint64.comment:
Sets the eight bytes starting at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint64.byteOffset in this object to the unsigned binary representation of the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint64.value, which must fit in eight bytes. in other words, dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint64.value must be between 0 and 2<sup>64</sup> - 1, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint64.byteOffset is negative, or byteOffset + 8 is greater than the length of this object.

setUint8.name: setUint8
setUint8.comment:
Sets the byte at the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint8.byteOffset in this object to the unsigned binary representation of the specified dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint8.value, which must fit in a single byte. in other words, dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint8.value must be between 0 and 255, inclusive.

Throws dart-core.RangeError if dart-typed_data.ByteData.setUint8.byteOffset is negative, or greater than or equal to the length of this object.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides dart-typed_data.ByteData.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

buffer.name: buffer
buffer.comment: Returns the byte buffer associated with this object.

lengthInBytes.name: lengthInBytes
lengthInBytes.comment: Returns the length of this view, in bytes.

offsetInBytes.name: offsetInBytes
offsetInBytes.comment: Returns the offset in bytes into the underlying byte buffer of this view.

elementSizeInBytes.name: elementSizeInBytes
elementSizeInBytes.comment: Returns the number of bytes in the representation of each element in this list.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and dart-typed_data.ByteData.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the dart-typed_data.ByteData.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
dart-typed_data.ByteData.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to dart-typed_data.ByteData.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If dart-typed_data.ByteData.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of dart-typed_data.ByteData.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
